intro: Hexachlamys boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian star-leaf, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
